result.execSummary:
The defendant Donte Q McBride was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
First 30 days Jail (Straight Time) and remaining  Huber with standard release conditions.
Credit For Time Served 0 Days.
Consecutive to: Outagamie County Case #09CF659.

miscConds.notes:
To be paid as a Condition of Probation at the rate of $25.00 per month starting 09-01-2015.  Failure to pay the Court orders 3 days Huber as Contempt for non-compliance with Court Order.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign any/all Medical Releases for Agent.
Obtain a valid driver's license within 90 days.

Case #14CM2240 was Dismissed and Read into Case #15CM1265.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donte Q McBride
